stadium.name: The Buccaneer's Bowl
stadium.description: A flashy, pristine stadium built on a private beach exclusively for resort guests. The field is imported turf, and a massive, puppet kraken in the bay entertains the crowd at halftime.

stats.pregame_ritual: Slapping their own helmet until their ears ring.
Sticking leeches to their legs to 'lighten their step'.
Bribing a local oracle with a meat pie for a vague prophecy.
Reviewing hand signals for secret plays.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Painting their teeth with a mixture of charcoal and water.
Doing a series of loud, guttural breathing exercises.
Reciting their grocery list backward to clear their mind.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.

stadium.name: The Cliffside Pitch
stadium.description: A perilous, windswept field built next to the town's lighthouse. There is no ocean-side barrier, and the wind is notoriously unpredictable. The tusk-like lighthouse is the only landmark.

stats.pregame_ritual: Telling each other exaggerated lies about their own strength.
Stretching their hamstrings for exactly seven minutes.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Arranging their gear in a perfect, aesthetically pleasing spiral.
Adjusting their codpiece with theatrical importance.
Getting a teammate to pour a bucket of cold water over their head.
Muttering a nonsensical rhyme to ward off bad spirits.
Filing down a single fingernail into a sharp point.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Wearing a necklace of polished river stones.

preGame:
## üî• TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL IS ON THE AIR! üî•

Hello, hello, hello all you fiends, fanatics, and followers of the greatest sport in Osterra! This is your favorite demonic announcer, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live for another spectacular evening of bone-crunching, goal-scoring, soul-crushing action! And what a match-up we have for you tonight, folks! It's a classic clash of cultures, a battle of the brash and the bizarre!

In this corner, visiting from the dreary, windswept cliffs of the north, we have the **Southport Narwhals**! üêã These hardy folks are used to gale-force winds and rocky outcroppings, not the blinding sun and distracted tourists of their opponents' home turf. I hear their pre-game ritual involves telling each other tall tales about their own strength. Well, they'll need more than lies to win tonight, but that's a start I can get behind! Keep an eye on Cilurzo Sochor, who apparently gives the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game. Let's hope tonight's story has a glorious, violent ending!

And in the other corner, playing on their home turf at the Buccaneer's Bowl on fancy-pants Toast Island, it's **The Tortell Privateers**! üè¥‚Äç‚ò†Ô∏è These buccaneers are used to the finer things in life, but don't let the resort security fool you, they're here to play rough! How rough? Well, Lilithe Royce is preparing by sticking leeches to her legs to 'lighten their step,' and Dib Tufts just chugged a raw egg, shell and all! That's the kind of dedication that warms my corrupted heart! They're fighting for the pride of Cedar Hill, so let's hope they do better than Elspeth Ortell at making a good impression!

The air is thick with anticipation, the crowd is roaring, and the players are practically vibrating with the need for violence! Will the hardy Narwhals freeze out the Privateers, or will the resort-town raiders make their guests proud? Stick around, folks, because the chaos is about to begin!
postGame:
## üí• WHAT A WALLOPING! A SHUTOUT SPECTACULAR! üí•

Folks, if you weren't tuned in, you missed an absolute masterclass in devastation! The visiting Southport Narwhals didn't just walk into the Buccaneer's Bowl; they stormed the beach, smashed the sandcastles, and left the home team wondering what just hit them!

### The First Half Frenzy

The action started faster than Sir Artorias runs from a real challenge! The ball is barely in play before Southport's Blood Eppes scoops it up. And before the Privateers could even blink, Cilurzo Sochor sends Loralee Sunny to the dirt with a beautiful swing of his Hatchet! KNOCKED OUT! ü™ì

With the defense still reeling, Blood Eppes seized the moment! He winds up from Center Field and lets it fly... IT'S GOOD! A two-point shot to open the game! The Narwhals go up 2-0 just like that! The tourists in the stands didn't know what to cheer for!

But the Narwhals weren't done, not by a long shot! Fineman Dolhenty gets the ball, tucks it under her arm, and weaves through the Privateers' defense like they were standing still! She crosses the line for another point! 3-0! An absolute blitzkrieg!

Oh, the Privateers tried to fight back, bless their little hearts. We saw some magnificent stalemates, with players locked in struggles that were pure poetry. But the Narwhals' fury was relentless. Torey Dannye turned into a one-man wrecking crew, knocking out Castorina Gies AND Ellan Elburt with that gorgeous Swordstaff! ‚öîÔ∏è

And to add insult to injury, Cibis Areta sliced through the remaining defense and scored AGAIN for the Narwhals! Just before the half, the score was an unbelievable 4-to-NOTHING!

### A Merciful Halftime

The halftime whistle was less of a break and more of a rescue mission for the Tortell Privateers. Their healer, Eugen Zacks, had his work cut out for him, scraping his players off the pristine turf while the Narwhals probably gargled saltwater and sharpened their weapons.

### The Second Half Scramble

The second half was a desperate, chaotic scramble, and I LOVED EVERY SECOND OF IT! The Privateers came out swinging, with Castorina Gies immediately knocking out Cibis Areta! But in a beautiful twist of violent fate, Areta took Gies down with her! A mutual knockout! You love to see that kind of spite!

The Narwhals continued their offensive push, with Blanc Fantasia making a heroic run from one end of the field to the other, but the Privateers' defense, finally showing a spark of life, forced a fumble. They managed to stop the bleeding, but they just couldn't get their own offense going.

Keisling Damalas had a chance, a real shot at getting his team on the board, but his throw from the 2-point zone fell short! A heartbreaker for the home team! The Narwhals scooped up the ball and went on another long, grinding drive down the field, chewing up the clock and the Privateers' morale.

As the final whistle blew, the Tortell Privateers were left standing on their perfect, imported turf without a single point to their name. A complete and utter domination by the visitors from the north!

### FINAL SCORE

Your final score tonight, folks, is a stunning testament to the power of the north! 

*   **The Southport Narwhals: 4**
*   **The Tortell Privateers: 0**

What a performance! The Narwhals came into a hostile, sunny environment and played their game with grit, power, and beautiful, beautiful violence. The Privateers have a lot to think about on that long walk back to the resort bar. Maybe they should try chugging two eggs next time.

That's all for tonight, my friends! This is Nok the Corrupter, signing off from another glorious night of TUESDAY NIGHT TROLLBALL! Keep it bloody!
